channel.title: Homes on Alison Presmanes Hill
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Alison Presmanes Hill

item.description: About me I am an Associate Professor of Pediatrics at Oregon Health & Science University (OHSU) in Portland, Oregon, and the Assistant Director of OHSU’s Center for Spoken Language Understanding, home to the Computer Science graduate education program. I study health-related applications of Natural Language Processing-based methods, with a focus on pediatric populations with developmental disabilities like Autism Spectrum Disorders, which I’ve studied for the past 15 years. In addition to research, I teach graduate-level data science courses and lead workshops on statistics, data analysis, and data visualization using the statistical programming language R.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: I teach the following courses in OHSU’s Computer Science and Electrical Engineering (CSEE) graduate education program: MATH530/630: Probability and Statistics for Scientists & Engineers CS627: Data Science Programming (with Professors Alexander Kain & Steven Bedrick) CS631: Principles and Practices of Data Visualization (with Professors Steven Bedrick & Jackie Wirz)
